SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

sailpoint.workflow
Class StandardWorkflowHandler

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.workflow.AbstractWorkflowHandler
      sailpoint.workflow.StandardWorkflowHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
WorkItemHandler, WorkflowHandler
public class StandardWorkflowHandler
extends AbstractWorkflowHandler

Default WorkflowHandler for most IdentityIQ workflows. You should not need to replace this but you might want to extend it to add custom handler methods.

Nested Class Summary

ARG_NOTIFICATION_SCHEME

public static final java.lang.String ARG_NOTIFICATION_SCHEME
WorkflowContext argument to specify the notification scheme to use in StandardWorkflowHandler.sendMultipleNotifications(WorkflowContext). Can be a comma-separated string or List that contains one or more of: StandardWorkflowHandler.ARG_NOTIFICATION_OTHERS, "user", "manager", "requester", "securityOfficer".

See Also:

VAR_SCHEDULED_REQUESTS

public static final java.lang.String VAR_SCHEDULED_REQUESTS
Workflow variable where we maintain a list of the ids of Requests scheduled during the case. This is mostly for testing so we can get a handle on Requests and wait for them to complete.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_COMMIT_CREATOR

public static final java.lang.String ARG_COMMIT_CREATOR
The name to be used as the "creator" of a BundleArchive. If not set it defaults to the case launcher.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_COMMIT_ARCHIVE

public static final java.lang.String ARG_COMMIT_ARCHIVE
True to create an archive of the current object before saving the new object. There are two possible default values. For simple editing workflows the default is true. For rollback workflows the default is false.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

startWorkflow

public void startWorkflow(WorkflowContext wfc)
                   throws GeneralException
Start process monitoring for the workflow. Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called when the WorkflowCase starts. Possible use as a hook to setup workflow variables.

Specified by:
startWorkflow in interface WorkflowHandler
Overrides:
startWorkflow in class AbstractWorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

endWorkflow

public void endWorkflow(WorkflowContext wfc)
                 throws GeneralException
End process monitoring for the workflow. Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called when the WorkflowCase completes. Possible use as a hook to take action on what happened in the workflow, though you could use a final Step for the same purpose.

Specified by:
endWorkflow in interface WorkflowHandler
Overrides:
endWorkflow in class AbstractWorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

               throws GeneralException
Start process monitoring for the current step. Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Step starts. WorkflowContext will have the Step about to start.

             throws GeneralException
End process monitoring for the current step. Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Step completes. WorkflowContext will have the Step that has just completed.

startApproval

public void startApproval(WorkflowContext wfc)
                   throws GeneralException
Start process monitoring for the current approval. Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Approval starts. WorkflowContext will have the Approval about to start. The owner expressions have already been evaluated and the Approval hierarchy has been refactored if necessary. If this is a leaf Approval, the WorkItem has not yet been generated.

Specified by:
startApproval in interface WorkflowHandler
Overrides:
startApproval in class AbstractWorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

endApproval

public void endApproval(WorkflowContext wfc)
                 throws GeneralException
End process monitoring for the current approval. Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Approval completes. WorkflowContext will have the Approval that has just completed. This is perhaps the most useful callback, it can be used with the "poll" modes to take incremental action as approvals are approved or rejected.

Specified by:
endApproval in interface WorkflowHandler
Overrides:
endApproval in class AbstractWorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

getProperty

public java.lang.Object getProperty(WorkflowContext wfc)
Return the value of a system property. ARG_NAME has the name of the property.

isProperty

public java.lang.Object isProperty(WorkflowContext wfc)

getMessage

public java.lang.Object getMessage(WorkflowContext wfc)
Construct a Message from the arguments.

ARG_MESSAGE may either be a String or a pre-constructed Message object.

If the message is a string, it can either be a message key or literal text. Literal text is allowed to contain the $() pattern to reference workflow variables and step arguments. For example:

If the message is a catalog key:

Then the the step arguments with names of the form "arg" where is an integer will be passed as arguments to the message renderer ordered by their number.

ARG_TYPE can be passed to specify the severity of the message. It is expected to be the string representation of a sailpoint.tools.Message.Type. By default it will be Message.Type.Info.

addMessage

public java.lang.Object addMessage(WorkflowContext wfc)
Add a mesasge to the case.

Uses StandardWorkflowHandler.getMessage(WorkflowContext) to construct the message.

Case messages will be returned in the WorkflowLaunch object when the case is launched. UIs are expected to display the messages. This gives the workflow control over what to show in the UI after launch, for example, "Identity change being approved" or "Identity being provisioned".

The Message object is returned though that is not usually useful.

addLaunchMessage

public java.lang.Object addLaunchMessage(WorkflowContext wfc)
Add a message to the WorkflowLaunch. This can be only be used when the workflow is launched for the first time before it suspends on an approval.

It is intended to let the workflow format a message to be displayed in the UI immediately after the launch that does not have to also be stored in the workflow case.

If this is not called, then the default behavior is to display all case messages.

You use this for messages like "Request has been submitted" or "Request is being approved by Foo" that the launcher needs to see, but which do not need to be kept in the task result forever like normal case messages.

setLaunchMessage

public java.lang.Object setLaunchMessage(WorkflowContext wfc)
Set the workflow launch message. See addLaunchMesasge for more about what launch messages do.

This is used in cases where a previous launch message might have been set but we now want to replace it based on the new state of the workflow.

log

public java.lang.Object log(WorkflowContext wfc)
Send something to log4j. You will need to enable trace for sailpoint.WorkflowTrace. The default level is "info". ARG_MESSAGE has the text and ARG_LOG_LEVEL has the level: debug, trace, warn, error.

print

public java.lang.Object print(WorkflowContext wfc)
Print something to the console. An alternative to logging if you do not want to mess with log4j.properties. ARG_MESSAGE has the text.

audit

public java.lang.Object audit(WorkflowContext wfc)
Create an audit event. These arguments are expected:
  • ARG_AUDIT_SOURCE
  • ARG_AUDIT_ACTION
  • ARG_AUDIT_TARGET
  • ARG_AUDIT_STRING1
  • ARG_AUDIT_STRING2
  • ARG_AUDIT_STRING3
  • ARG_AUDIT_STRING4

sendEmail

public java.lang.Object sendEmail(WorkflowContext wfc)
                           throws GeneralException
Send an email notification. Expected arguments are in the EmailArgument enumeration.

Optional argument named exceptionOnFailure, when true will cause this method to throw an exception when there is a failure sending a message.

This method returns a Message object when there was a problem sending the email. The message will be of Type.Warn if it was retryable and Type.Error when there was an failure that will not be retried. On success the Message object will be null.

Parameters:
wfc - Current WorkflowContext
Returns:
Message containing the results of attempting to send an e-mail
Throws:
GeneralException

sendMultipleNotifications

public java.lang.Object sendMultipleNotifications(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                           throws GeneralException
This is similar to the sendEmail method except that it processes multiple notifications at once so it can be called from a single step

Parameters:
wfc - Current WorkflowContext
Returns:
List containing the results of attempting to send the e-mails
Throws:
GeneralException
See Also:
"#sendEmail(WorkflowContext)"

launchTask

public java.lang.Object launchTask(WorkflowContext wfc)
                            throws GeneralException
Launch a task. 
 Arguments:
   taskDefinition - required name of the TaskDefinition to launch
   taskResult - optional name of the TaskResult
   sync - "true" to request synchronous execution
   * - all other args passed as task launch arguments
 
 Returns:
   TaskResult

 Sets:
   taskLaunchError - null or a Message object
The workflow variable taskLaunchError is set as a side effect for use in transition conditions. It will be null if the task was launched successfully or a Message object if the launch failed.

Throws:
GeneralException

scheduleRequest

public java.lang.Object scheduleRequest(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                 throws GeneralException
Launch a generic event request. 
 Arguments:
 
   requestDefinition
     - required name of the RequestDefinition to launch
 
   requestName
     - name you want to give the request
 
   scheduleDate 
     - date at which to perform request, if not specified request
       is processed on the next request manager cycle

   scheduleDelaySeconds
     - alternate to date, the number of seconds after the
       current time to schedule the event 

   launcher
     - name considered to be the source of the request
       defaults to Workflow launcher if not specified
 
   owner
     - identity to be considered the owner of this request
       used for "event" requsts
   * 
     - all other args passed as request arguments
  
 Sets:
   requestError - null or a Message object
The workflow variable requestError is set as a side effect for use in transition conditions. It will be null if the task was launched successfully or a Message object if the launch failed.

Throws:
GeneralException

scheduleWorkflowEvent

public java.lang.Object scheduleWorkflowEvent(WorkflowContext wfc)
                                       throws GeneralException
Launch a workflow event request. Arguments are the same as those for scheduleEvent except for these: 
 Arguments:
 
   workflow
     - name of the Workflow to launch
 
   caseName
     - optional case name to override the default
 
   requestDefinition
     - not specified, set to standard definition for
       workflow requests
 
 Sets:
   requestError - null or a Message object
This is just a wrapper around scheduleRequest specifying the stock RequestDefinition for workflow events and validating the extra arguments.

Throws:
GeneralException

commit

public java.lang.Object commit(WorkflowContext wfc)
                        throws GeneralException
Commit an object stored within the workflow case to the database, typically after an approval step.

There are two variants of this, one that commits changes to an object, and one that commits the deletion of an object.

This is where role archives are created.

Archival must be requested by passing the "doArchive" argument. This is normally defined as a configuration variable in the Workflow.

Arguments recognized:

  • ARG_COMMIT_ARCHIVE
  • ARG_COMMIT_CREATOR

Throws:
GeneralException

rollback

public java.lang.Object rollback(WorkflowContext wfc)
                          throws GeneralException
Rollback a change to an object held in the workflow. This is not technically a rollback since the changes were never persisted in the first place. What we do however is remove the linkage between the object being edited and the workflow case so it becomes "unlocked" and can be edited again.

Throws:
GeneralException

getMessage

public static java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.String key,
                                          java.lang.Object arg)
Localize a message.

getStringList

protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.Object value)
Coerce the given value into a list of strings. The value of the selections argument can be one of: - String - List Further, each String can be a CSV.

Ignore design notes (see ExcludeDoclet)
Created for the ARG_SELECTIONS argument used with remediateViolation but relatively general. Items returned by getRemediatables will be CSVs, and since you can select both left and right sides the selection may be a List of CSVs. We need to flatten all this into a list of role names for remediation.
